alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lawrence; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 6:02PM EST until February 28 at 5:47AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana... East Fork White River ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River, White River. .Multiple rounds of recent precipitation, preceded by snow melt, will keep minor flooding ongoing along much of the East Fork White, lower White and Wabash rivers. Moderate flooding is occurring on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel, and on the White River at Hazleton. The crest on the Wabash River is near Mount Carmel, and the crest on the White River is between Petersburg and Hazleton. The East Fork White River is slowly rising near Rivervale and points downstream. Flooding on the lower portions of the Wabash and White rivers is expected to last into the second week of March. The East Fork White river is expected to remain in flood until about March 5. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Seymour. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Significant agricultural lands begins to flood. High water affects some local roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Sunday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM EST Sunday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 6.8 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday morning by around 600 AM EST /500 AM CST/.
